author: Slidebean
description:
A satellite just found enough lithium for 70 million electric cars by accident.

Fleet Space, an Australian company, pointed satellites at Quebec and used AI to reinterpret geology miners thought they already understood.

They didn’t discover new land, they discovered we’d been reading the maps wrong.
The AI found patterns showing 3× more lithium under Quebec than previous estimates.

And it took weeks, not years of digging.

Now this tech is being aimed at other regions… meaning the next lithium boom might come from data, not drills.

We recently visited the Lithium Triangle, the most valuable land in the continent, go watch that episode on the youtube channel
title: AI + satellites just found a massive hidden lithium reserve.
